rule.name: Fix schema errors
rule.description:
The XML files within a wsp solution should not contain schema errors.

See SPCAF documentation

rule.name: Declare required attribute 'SolutionId' in Solution
rule.description:
Required attribute 'SolutionId' must be declared in Solution.

See SPCAF documentation

rule.name: Define a valid GUID for attribute 'SolutionId' in Solution
rule.description:
The attribute 'SolutionId' in Solution must be a valid GUID. Otherwise the deployment or retraction of the solution may not work properly.

See SPCAF documentation

rule.name: Remove unused files from Solution package
rule.description:
Files in the solution package which are not listed in manifest.xml or in a feature.xml should be removed from the package.

See SPCAF documentation

rule.name: Remove empty Resource files
rule.description:
If Resource files (.resx) are empty they could be removed.

See SPCAF documentation

rule.name: Avoid duplicate keys in Resource file
rule.description:
Using duplicate keys in a Resource file (.resx) could lead to unexpected results.

See SPCAF documentation

rule.name: Declare element 'SiteDefinition' in Solution
rule.description:
A deployed SiteDefinition should be included correctly in manifest.xml of the Solution.

See SPCAF documentation

rule.name: Do not reference WebApplication Feature in attribute 'VisibilityFeatureDependency'
rule.description:
The attribute 'VisibilityFeatureDependency' is not supported for Features with Web application scope.

See SPCAF documentation

rule.name: Declare required attributes in Feature
rule.description:
Required attributes Id and Scope must be declared in Feature.

See SPCAF documentation

rule.name: Define a valid GUID for attribute 'Id' in Feature
rule.description:
The attribute 'Id' in Feature must be a valid GUID.

See SPCAF documentation

rule.name: Remove spaces from Feature folder
rule.description:
SharePoint Foundation supports no spaces for Feature folder and file names.

See SPCAF documentation

rule.name: Define attribute 'Title' in Feature with max. 255 characters
rule.description:
The attribute 'Title' of a Feature is limited to 255 characters.

See SPCAF documentation

rule.name: Do not define attribute 'ActiveOnDefault' in Feature with Scope 'Web' or 'Site'
rule.description:
Attribute 'ActivateOnDefault' cannot be 'TRUE' for Feature with Scope 'Web' or 'Site', except in Sandboxed solutions. In Sandboxed solutions the attribute is used during activation of the solution to activate Feature with scope 'Site'. This behavior is not documented in MSDN and may be unexpected und unintended.

See SPCAF documentation

rule.name: Do not define attribute 'AutoActivateInCentralAdmin' in Feature with Scope 'Farm'
rule.description:
AutoActivateInCentralAdmin cannot be TRUE for Feature with Scope 'Farm'.

See SPCAF documentation

rule.name: Define required attributes for Feature receiver
rule.description:
Attributes 'ReceiverAssembly' and 'ReceiverClass' must be defined in conjunction.

See SPCAF documentation

rule.name: Define correct SolutionId in Feature
rule.description:
All features in a solution must correctly reference their parent solution via the SolutionId property.

See SPCAF documentation

rule.name: Define ReceiverAssembly in Feature correctly
rule.description:
ReceiverAssembly in Feature should contain the full qualified name of the referenced assembly.

See SPCAF documentation

rule.name: Define Version in Feature correctly
rule.description:
Version in Feature should contain a correct version number.

See SPCAF documentation

rule.name: Add missing assembly for 'ReceiverAssembly' in Feature
rule.description:
If a Feature references an assembly in attribute 'ReceiverAssembly' the assembly should be available.

See SPCAF documentation

rule.name: Deploy the 'ReceiverAssembly' of a Feature to GAC
rule.description:
If a Feature references an assembly in attribute 'ReceiverAssembly' the assembly must be deployed to GAC. Otherwise the assembly could not be loaded during feature activation.

See SPCAF documentation

rule.name: Declare attribute 'Title' in Feature
rule.description:
A Feature should have a Title.

See SPCAF documentation

rule.name: Do not define Feature Id with curly brackets
rule.description:
A Feature Id should not contain curly brackets at the beginning and end.

See SPCAF documentation

rule.name: Add Resources when DefaultResourceFile is declared
rule.description:
If attribute 'DefaultResourceFile' is declared the necessary Resource files must be available.

See SPCAF documentation

rule.name: Declare required fields in FieldType
rule.description:
Required fields Filterable, ParentType, Sortable, TypeDisplayName and TypeName must be declared in FieldType

See SPCAF documentation

rule.name: Do not declare field 'InternalType' in FieldTypes
rule.description:
Do not use a <Field Name="InternalType"> element in a custom field type definition.

See SPCAF documentation

rule.name: Do not declare field 'SQLType' in FieldTypes
rule.description:
Do not use a <Field Name="SQLType"> element in a custom field type definition. The field represents the SQL data type that will be used to store the data in the content database, but cannot be used in custom field types.

See SPCAF documentation

rule.name: Declare field 'FieldTypeClass' in FieldType
rule.description:
Field <Field Name="FieldTypeClass" /> is an optional element, but required for all custom field types. Represents the strong name of the field type class library.

See SPCAF documentation

rule.name: Do not use obsolete RenderPattern in FieldTypes
rule.description:
RenderPattern in FieldTypes is obsolete.

See SPCAF documentation

rule.name: Do not use PropertySchema in FieldTypes
rule.description:
PropertySchema in FieldTypes is obsolete.

See SPCAF documentation

rule.name: Do not define Field in Feature with scope 'WebApplication' or 'Farm'
rule.description:
Field can only be deployed with Features of scope 'Web' or 'Site'.

See SPCAF documentation

rule.name: Add curly brackets to Field ID
rule.description:
Field ID must contain curly brackets.

See SPCAF documentation

rule.name: Define a unique Field ID
rule.description:
The ID of a Field must be unique in the farm.

See SPCAF documentation

rule.name: Define Field ID as valid GUID
rule.description:
Field ID must be a valid GUID.

See SPCAF documentation

rule.name: Declare required attributes in Field
rule.description:
Required attributes ID, Name and Type must be declared in Field.

See SPCAF documentation

rule.name: Define Field DisplayName with max. 255 characters
rule.description:
The DisplayName of a Field is limited to 255 characters.

See SPCAF documentation

rule.name: Do not use deprecated attribute 'FromBaseType'
rule.description:
Attribute 'FromBaseType' is deprecated in favor of the Sealed attribute.

See SPCAF documentation

rule.name: Declare all recommended attributes in Field
rule.description:
All recommended attributes ID, Type, Name, DisplayName, and Group should be declared in Field.

See SPCAF documentation

rule.name: Do not define lower case attribute 'Id' in Field
rule.description:
The Field ID must be define in upper case attribute 'ID', not in the lower case attribute 'Id'.

See SPCAF documentation

rule.name: Declare attribute 'Mult' for Type 'LookupMulti' and 'UserMulti'
rule.description:
If attribute 'Type' of a field is 'LookupMulti' or 'UserMulti' the attribute 'Mult' must be set to TRUE.

See SPCAF documentation

rule.name: Define a unique Field Name
rule.description:
The Name of a Field should be unique in the farm.

See SPCAF documentation

rule.name: Define a unique Field StaticName
rule.description:
The StaticName of a Field should be unique in the farm.

See SPCAF documentation

rule.name: Do not define ContentType ID longer than 1024 characters
rule.description:
Content type IDs have a maximum length of 512 bytes. Because two hexadecimal characters can fit in each byte, each content type ID has an effective maximum length of 1024 characters.

See SPCAF documentation

rule.name: Do not define ContentType in Feature with scope 'WebApplication' or 'Farm'
rule.description:
ContentType can only be deployed with Features of scope 'Web' or 'Site'.

See SPCAF documentation

rule.name: Declare required attributes in ContentType
rule.description:
Required attributes ID and Name must be declared in ContentType.

See SPCAF documentation

rule.name: Do not define duplicate ContentType ID
rule.description:
ContentType ID must be unique.

See SPCAF documentation

rule.name: Do not define ContentType Name longer than 124 characters
rule.description:
Length of attribute 'Name' in content types is limited to 124 characters. The name itself cannot be longer than 128 characters and cannot contain the characters \ / : * ? " # % < > { } | ~ &, two consecutive periods (..), or special characters such as a tab.

See SPCAF documentation

rule.name: Define ContentTypes ID as hexadecimal GUID
rule.description:
It is recommended to use the GUID approach to identify any content types that are direct children of content types you did not create. Use the GUID approach if the parent content type is one of the following. That way, you are assured that the content type ID is unique and will not be duplicated later by the developer of the parent content type.

See SPCAF documentation

rule.name: Do not declare attributes in ContentType which are reserved for internal use
rule.description:
The attribute 'BaseType' is reserved for internal use and should not be declared in ContentType.

See SPCAF documentation

rule.name: Do not declare obsolete attributes in ContentType
rule.description:
The attributes 'ResourceFolder' and 'DocumentTemplate' are obsolete and should not be declared in ContentType.

See SPCAF documentation

rule.name: Inherit ContentType from existing parent ContentType
rule.description:
The parent ContentType of a ContentType must be either a SharePoint ContentType or a ContentType within the WSP solutions.

See SPCAF documentation

rule.name: Define correct parent FeatureId in ContentType
rule.description:
If ContentType defines attribute 'FeatureId' the value must be correct and include braces.

See SPCAF documentation

rule.name: Define attribute 'Inherits' to FALSE in ContentType if RemoveFieldRef are used
rule.description:
A content type should not have attribute 'Inherits' set to 'TRUE' if elements of type 'RemoveFieldRef' are used. Set Inherits to 'FALSE' or hide the not used columns with Hidden=TRUE to remove fields from a content type.

See SPCAF documentation

rule.name: Define attribute 'Inherits' to FALSE in ContentType if Custom Forms are used
rule.description:
A content type should not have attribute 'Inherits' set to 'TRUE' if custom forms are used. Set Inherits to 'FALSE' or remove the custom form from a content type.

See SPCAF documentation

rule.name: Avoid XML comments inside a ContentType definition
rule.description:
Comments inside the ContentType definition (XML) can break loading them.

See SPCAF documentation

rule.name: Do not define Module in Feature with scope 'WebApplication' or 'Farm'
rule.description:
Module can only be deployed with Features of scope 'Web' or 'Site'.

See SPCAF documentation

rule.name: Add missing referenced File for Module
rule.description:
A Module in a Feature deploys files which are included in the feature as ElementFile. The rule checks if this referenced file is available or not.

See SPCAF documentation

rule.name: Declare File element in Module
rule.description:
A Module should contain at least one File element as child. Otherwise the Module has no need and should be removed.

See SPCAF documentation

rule.name: Do not define ListInstance in Feature with scope 'WebApplication' or 'Farm'
rule.description:
ListInstance can only be deployed with Features of scope 'Web' or 'Site'.

See SPCAF documentation

rule.name: Declare required attributes in ListInstance
rule.description:
Required attributes TemplateType, Title and Url be declared in ListInstance.

See SPCAF documentation

rule.name: Define unique value for attribute 'Id' in ListInstance
rule.description:
If a value is defined for attribute 'Id' is defined in a ListInstance the value must be unique within the same Feature.

See SPCAF documentation

rule.name: Deploy missing ListTemplate for ListInstance
rule.description:
A ListInstance instantiates lists based on a ListTemplate. This ListTemplate must be either a SharePoint default ListTemplate or a custom ListTemplate which must be deployed.

See SPCAF documentation

rule.name: Remove curly brackets from attribute FeatureId in ListInstance
rule.description:
Curly brackets should be removed from attribute 'FeatureId' in ListInstance.

See SPCAF documentation

rule.name: Deploy missing ListDefinition in CustomSchema of ListInstance
rule.description:
A ListInstance can directly reference a ListDefinition in attribute 'CustomSchema'. This ListDefinition must be depoyed in the same Feature as ElementFile.

See SPCAF documentation

rule.name: Do not define ListTemplate in Feature with scope 'WebApplication' or 'Farm'
rule.description:
ListTemplate can only be deployed with Features of scope 'Web' or 'Site'.

See SPCAF documentation

rule.name: Declare required attributes in ListTemplate
rule.description:
Required attributes BaseType, DisplayName and Name must be declared in ListTemplate.

See SPCAF documentation

rule.name: Do not define ListTemplate Name with spaces
rule.description:
Name of ListTemplate cannot contain spaces or special characters.

See SPCAF documentation

rule.name: Define unique attribute 'Type' for ListTemplate
rule.description:
The attribute 'Type' must be unique within the Feature.

See SPCAF documentation

rule.name: Deploy missing Image in ListTemplate
rule.description:
If a ListTemplate references a file in attribute 'Image' (e.g. an icon) the file must be deployed.

See SPCAF documentation

rule.name: Do not deploy Taxonomy fields using ListTemplate.
rule.description:
Taxonomy fields should be deployed by content types, not inside ListTemplates.

See SPCAF documentation

rule.name: Do not define ContentTypeBinding in Feature with scope 'WebApplication' or 'Farm'
rule.description:
ContentTypeBinding can only be deployed with Features of scope 'Web' or 'Site'.

See SPCAF documentation

rule.name: Declare required attribute in CustomAction
rule.description:
Required attribute 'Title' must be declared in CustomAction.

See SPCAF documentation

rule.name: Define unique value for 'Id' in CustomAction
rule.description:
Define a unique value for attribute 'Id' in CustomAction. The ID may be a GUID, or it may be a unique term.

See SPCAF documentation

rule.name: Deploy missing file in UrlAction for CustomAction
rule.description:
If a CustomAction references a file in attribute 'UrlAction' (e.g. ASPX page) the file must be deployed. Otherwise a click on this CustomAction will lead to 404 error.

See SPCAF documentation

rule.name: Deploy missing file in ImageUrl for CustomAction
rule.description:
If a CustomAction references a file in attribute 'ImageUrl' (e.g. an icon) the file must be deployed.

See SPCAF documentation

rule.name: Deploy missing file in Ribbon for CustomAction
rule.description:
If a CustomAction references a file in ribbon (e.g. an icon) the file must be deployed.

See SPCAF documentation

rule.name: Deploy missing file in CommandUIHandler for CustomAction
rule.description:
If a CustomAction references a file in ribbon CommandUIHandler (e.g. a page) the file must be deployed.

See SPCAF documentation

rule.name: Declare required attributes in CustomActionGroup
rule.description:
Required attributes 'Location' and 'Title' must be declared in CustomActionGroup.

See SPCAF documentation

rule.name: Do not define Receiver in Feature with scope 'WebApplication' or 'Farm'
rule.description:
Receiver can only be deployed with Features of scope 'Web' or 'Site'.

See SPCAF documentation

rule.name: Declare Scope for Receivers in Site Features
rule.description:
If event receivers are used within a feature with scope 'Site' the attribute 'Scope' should be specified.

See SPCAF documentation

rule.name: Do not define Receiver 'EmailReceived' on SiteCollection level.
rule.description:
If email event receivers are used within a feature with scope 'Site' the attribute 'Scope' must be set to 'Web' or the event receiver must be deployed via a web scopes feature.

See SPCAF documentation

rule.name: Define ControlAssembly and ControlClass in DelegateControl
rule.description:
When implementing a server control (DelegateControl), use both the ControlAssembly and ControlClass attributes.

See SPCAF documentation

rule.name: Deploy missing assembly from attribute ControlAssembly
rule.description:
When using attribute ControlAssembly the referenced assembly must be deployed to SharePoint or must be a SharePoint assembly.

See SPCAF documentation

rule.name: Deploy missing control from attribute ControlSrc
rule.description:
When using attribute ControlSrc the referenced ascx control must be deployed to SharePoint or must be a SharePoint control.

See SPCAF documentation

rule.name: Do not define Worfklow in Feature with scope 'Web', 'WebApplication' or 'Farm'
rule.description:
Worfklow can only be deployed with Features of scope 'Site'.

See SPCAF documentation

rule.name: Declare required attributes in Workflow
rule.description:
Required attributes Name, CodeBesideAssembly, CodeBesideClass and Id must be declared in Workflow.

See SPCAF documentation

rule.name: Define a valid GUID for attribute 'Id' in Workflow
rule.description:
The attribute 'Id' in Workflow must be a valid GUID.

See SPCAF documentation

rule.name: Do not define DocumentConveter in Feature with scope 'Web', 'Site' or 'Farm'
rule.description:
DocumentConveter can only be deployed with Features of scope 'WebApplication'.

See SPCAF documentation

rule.name: Declare property 'Title' in WebParts
rule.description:
WebPart should contain a title which is visible to the user in SharePoint.

See SPCAF documentation

rule.name: Declare required attributes in FieldRef
rule.description:
Required attributes ID, Name must be declared in FieldRef.

See SPCAF documentation

rule.name: Define attribute 'ID' with curly brackets in FieldRef
rule.description:
The attribute 'ID' in elements of type 'FieldRef' should start and end with '}'. Otherwise they may not work correctly.

See SPCAF documentation

rule.name: Define attribute 'ID' in FieldRef in correct casing
rule.description:
The attribute 'ID' in elements of type 'FieldRef' is case sensitive. It must use the same casing as the ID of the referenced field.

See SPCAF documentation

rule.name: Declare required attributes in RemoveFieldRef
rule.description:
Required attributes ID must be declared in RemoveFieldRef.

See SPCAF documentation

rule.name: Do not declare ignored attributes in RemoveFieldRef
rule.description:
Do not declare attributes except ID in RemoveFieldRef. All other attributes are ignored by SharePoint.

See SPCAF documentation

rule.name: Define attribute 'ID' with curly brackets in RemoveFieldRef
rule.description:
The attribute 'ID' in elements of type 'RemoveFieldRef' should start and end with '}'. Otherwise they may not work correctly.

See SPCAF documentation

rule.name: Do not define TemplateAssociation in Feature with scope 'Web'
rule.description:
TemplateAssociation (FeatureSiteTemplateAssociationDefinition) can only be deployed with Features of scope 'Site', 'WebApplication' or 'Farm'.

See SPCAF documentation

rule.name: Declare required attributes in TemplateAssocation
rule.description:
Required attributes Id and TemplateName must be declared in TemplateAssocation.

See SPCAF documentation

rule.name: Do not define PropertyBag in Feature with scope 'WebApplication' or 'Farm'
rule.description:
PropertyBag can only be deployed with Features of scope 'Web' or 'Site'.

See SPCAF documentation

rule.name: Declare required attributes in FeatureActivationDependency
rule.description:
Required attribute FeatureId must be declared in FeatureActivationDependency.

See SPCAF documentation

rule.name: Define optional attributes in FeatureActivationDependency correctly
rule.description:
If optional attributes in FeatureActivationDependency are defined (like the target 'FeatureTitle') the values must be the same.

See SPCAF documentation

rule.name: Do not add ActivationDependency to hidden Feature
rule.description:
Features with ActivationDependency cannot be hidden.

See SPCAF documentation

rule.name: Do not add ActivationDependency to a Feature with a more restrictive scope
rule.description:
A Feature cannot have an ActivationDependency to a more restrictive scope. For example, a site collection-scoped Feature cannot have an ActivationDependency on a Web site-scoped Feature.

See SPCAF documentation

rule.name: Do not add cross-scope ActivationDependency to a hidden Feature
rule.description:
A Feature cannot have an cross-scope ActivationDependency to a hidden Feature. For example, a Web site-scoped feature cannot be dependent on a site collection–scoped Feature that is not visible in the user interface.

See SPCAF documentation

rule.name: Do not chain ActivationDependencies of Features when last Feature is visible
rule.description:
ActivationDependencies can work only one level deep. SharePoint Foundation does not support more than one level in activation dependencies if the last Feature is visible.

See SPCAF documentation

rule.name: Do not create circular chain of FeatureActivationDependencies
rule.description:
ActivationDependencies between Features can result in a circular dependency which is not allowed.

See SPCAF documentation

rule.name: Declare element 'DefaultDescription' in schema of ListTemplate
rule.description:
The element 'DefaultDescription' must be declared in the schema.xml of a ListTemplate.

See SPCAF documentation

rule.name: Declare required attributes in schema of ListTemplate
rule.description:
The attribute 'Title', 'Name' and 'Direction' must be declared in the schema.xml of a ListTemplate.

See SPCAF documentation

rule.name: Deploy missing assembly for WebService (.svc)
rule.description:
A WCF Webservice (.svc) file references an assembly which handles the requests for the WebService. This assembly should be present in the solution.

See SPCAF documentation

rule.name: Declare required attributes in WebTemplate
rule.description:
Required attributes BaseTemplateID, BaseTemplateName, BaseConfigurationID and Name must be declared in WebTemplate.

See SPCAF documentation

rule.name: Derive WebTemplate from an existing Template
rule.description:
A WebTemplate must derive from an existing Template, e.g from a template in TEMPLATE\1033\XML\WEBTEMP.xml.

See SPCAF documentation

rule.name: Declare recommended attributes in WebTemplate
rule.description:
Attributes Title and Description should be declared in WebTemplate.

See SPCAF documentation

rule.name: Do not declare obsolete attributes
rule.description:
Obsolete attributes should not be declared and should be removed from the code.

See SPCAF documentation

rule.name: Define Boolean attributes in upper case
rule.description:
Boolean attributes should be define in upper case letters (TRUE or FALSE).

See SPCAF documentation

rule.name: Remove spaces from resource keys
rule.description:
If attributes in SharePoint elements are localized with resources the resource key cannot contains spaces.

See SPCAF documentation

rule.name: Add translation for a resource key
rule.description:
If attributes in SharePoint elements are localized with resources the resource key must be available in a resx file.

See SPCAF documentation

rule.name: CAS Policy 'Maschine' with access='Administer' is not allowed
rule.description:
The CAS Policy 'Maschine' with access='Administer' is not allowed.

See SPCAF documentation

rule.name: Policy Permission Impersonate not allowed
rule.description:
The CAS Policy for Microsoft.SharePoint.Security.SharePointPermission with settings Impersonate=true is not allowed.

See SPCAF documentation

rule.name: Do not define 'FileIOPermission' with 'Unrestricted=true'
rule.description:
The CAS Policy for System.Security.Permissions.FileIOPermission with setting 'Unrestricted=true' is not allowed. This means read and write permission to all locations on the SharePoint system. Limit the permission to certain folders, e.g. TEMP.

See SPCAF documentation

rule.name: Do not define 'RegistryPermission' with 'Unrestricted=true'
rule.description:
The CAS Policy for System.Security.Permissions.RegistryPermission with setting 'Unrestricted=true' is not allowed.

See SPCAF documentation

rule.name: Do not define 'SecurityPermission' with 'Unrestricted=true'
rule.description:
The CAS Policy for System.Security.Permissions.SecurityPermission with setting 'Unrestricted=true' is not allowed.

See SPCAF documentation

rule.name: Do not define 'EnvironmentPermission' with 'Unrestricted=true'
rule.description:
The CAS Policy for System.Security.Permissions.EnvironmentPermission with setting 'Unrestricted=true' is not allowed.

See SPCAF documentation

rule.name: Do not define 'SmtpPermission' with 'Unrestricted=true'
rule.description:
The CAS Policy for System.Net.Mail.SmtpPermission with setting 'Unrestricted=true' is not allowed.

See SPCAF documentation

rule.name: Do not set 'AllowEveryoneViewItems' to TRUE in ListDefinition
rule.description:
The attribute ListAllowEveryoneViewItems of a ListDefinition should not be set to true, as it allows every authenticated user of the web application to access the list items when the URL is known.

See SPCAF documentation

rule.name: Do not override SharePoint system files
rule.description:
Solutions must not override system files. If this solution is deployed it could damage the SharePoint farm and make it unreachable.

See SPCAF documentation

rule.name: Declare attribute 'Title' and 'Description' in Solutions
rule.description:
To make it easier to identify Solutions in the Solution Gallery in SharePoint the attributes 'Title' and 'Description' should be declared.

See SPCAF documentation

rule.name: Do not make SiteDefinition visible in the whole farm
rule.description:
Site definitions are visible in the whole farm by default. The attribute 'VisibilityFeatureDependency' provides a way to hide the site definition depending on an activated feature.

See SPCAF documentation

rule.name: Declare attribute 'Description' in Features
rule.description:
A Feature should contain a description of the purpose of a Feature in attribute 'Description'.

See SPCAF documentation

rule.name: Declare attribute 'Version' in Features
rule.description:
A feature should contain a valid version number in attribute 'Version'. This may be necessary to use FeatureUpgrade method to allow updates in the future.

See SPCAF documentation

rule.name: Make Features with scope 'Farm' or 'WebApplication' visible
rule.description:
Feature of scope 'Farm' or 'WebApplication' should not be hidden. They are not visible for the farm administrator in the Central Administration and cannot be deactivated via the UI e.g. in case of problems. If the feature is visible in the Central Administration the farm administrator can easier identify available and activated features.

See SPCAF documentation

rule.name: Consider to make Feature with scope 'Web' or 'Site' hidden
rule.description:
Consider to make Features with scope 'Web' or 'Site' hidden to avoid activation via the UI.

See SPCAF documentation

rule.name: Declare attribute 'Title' and 'Description' in FeatureActivitationDependencies
rule.description:
To make it easier to identify feature activation dependencies the attributes title and description should contain the title and description of the referenced feature.

See SPCAF documentation

rule.name: Define attribute 'ReceiverAssembly' in Feature as full qualified assembly name
rule.description:
If a Feature references an Assembly in attribute 'ReceiverAssembly' the given value should be a full qualified assembly name (e.g. 'System.Data, Version=1.0.3300.0, Culture=neutral, PublicKeyToken=b77a5c561934e089'). Although the order of the values in the assembly name is not mandatory a well-formed assembly name improves readability of the XML code.

See SPCAF documentation

rule.name: Declare all FieldTypes in a single file
rule.description:
If multiple FieldTypes are deployed by a Solution these FieldTypes should be store in a single XML file to avoid unnecessary files.

See SPCAF documentation

rule.name: Declare attribute 'Inherits' in ContentTypes
rule.description:
In SharePoint 2010 the new attribute 'Inherits' for ContentTypes defines whether fields of the parent ContentType are inherited to the ContentType. For compatibility reasons to SharePoint 2007 this attribute should be specified.

See SPCAF documentation

rule.name: Define attribute 'ID' in ContentTypes uppercase
rule.description:
The ID of a ContentType should by a GUID in uppercase letters to avoid problems when accessing ContentTypes in code.

See SPCAF documentation

rule.name: Declare 'TemplateType' and 'FeatureId' for external ListInstance
rule.description:
If the ListInstance seems to be used for an external list, the correct TemplateType (600) should be used.

See SPCAF documentation

rule.name: Declare attribute 'Description' in CustomActionGroup
rule.description:
CustomActionGroup should define attribute Description.

See SPCAF documentation

rule.name: Declare attribute 'Sequence' in DelegateControl.
rule.description:
Attribute 'Sequence' should be declared to specify the sequence number for the control, which determines whether the control is added to the control tree for a page. The control with the lowest sequence number is added to the tree.

See SPCAF documentation

rule.name: Declare attribute 'Id' in DelegateControl.
rule.description:
Attribute 'Id' should be declared. Otherwise the delegate control will never be added to a control container.

See SPCAF documentation

rule.name: Declare property 'Title' and 'Description' in WebPart
rule.description:
A WebPart should contain the attribute title and description to provide meaningfull information to the end user which would add the web part to a page.

See SPCAF documentation

rule.name: Do not use spaces in file or folders names
rule.description:
Files should be stored in subfolders which are named after the solution, or start with the solution. Avoid using dots or spaces in pathnames.

See SPCAF documentation

rule.name: Custom field types should not be user creatable
rule.description:
Custom field types should not be user creatable because in this case they are visible in the complete farm which may not be the intention.

See SPCAF documentation

rule.name: Attribute 'Name' and 'StaticName' should have the same value in Field
rule.description:
The value of attribute 'Name' and 'StaticName' should be the same in a Field. Otherwise it might lead to confusion when requesting the field via REST, in managed code etc.

See SPCAF documentation

rule.name: Consider setting attibute 'AllowDeletion' to FALSE in Field to prevent deletion by users
rule.description:
Setting the attribute 'AllowDeletion' to FALSE prevents unintended deletion of a Field by the user or administrator.

See SPCAF documentation

rule.name: Consider setting attibute 'Sealed' to TRUE in ContentType to prevent changes by users
rule.description:
Setting the attribute 'Sealed' to TRUE prevents unintended changes of a ContentType by the user or administrator.

See SPCAF documentation

rule.name: Define Type of ListTemplate greater than 10000
rule.description:
The ListTemplate Type should be greater than 10000. This makes it easier to identify custom ListTemplates.

See SPCAF documentation

rule.name: Add ContentType for folders to ListTemplate
rule.description:
A custom ListTemplate should contain the folder ContentType to work properly.

See SPCAF documentation

rule.name: Avoid definition of ContentTypes in ListTemplates.
rule.description:
ContentTypes which are defined in a ListTemplate are not re-usable. Better define the ContentType separately and reference the ContentType in the ListTemplate.

See SPCAF documentation

rule.name: Consider setting attibute 'AllowDeletion' to FALSE in ListTemplate to prevent deletion by users
rule.description:
Setting the attribute 'AllowDeletion' to FALSE prevents unintended deletion of a ListTemplate by the user or administrator.

See SPCAF documentation

rule.name: Declare property 'AllowClose' in WebPart to prevent closing of webpart by the user
rule.description:
A WebPart should contain the attribute 'AllowClose' with value False to prevent that users close the webpart. In this case the webpart would be disappear from the UI but will remain inside the page.

See SPCAF documentation

rule.name: Consider the deployment of solution per web application and not globally
rule.description:
Solution should not be deployed globally to reduce the impact of the solution for the SharePoint farm. Note: this guidance does not apply to SharePoint 2013 and further.

See SPCAF documentation

rule.name: Do not deploy prohibited assemblies
rule.description:
In some case WSPBuilder includes prohibited assemblies into the package, e.g. 'ssocli.dll'.

See SPCAF documentation

rule.name: Do not deploy thumbs.db
rule.description:
In some case the file thumbs.db is generated in a Visual Studio project. This file should not be included in the WSP package.

See SPCAF documentation

rule.name: Do not reset webserver
rule.description:
A solution should not reset the webserver.

See SPCAF documentation

rule.name: Define mode 'Recycle' for Solution upgrade
rule.description:
To reduce the downtime of a SharePoint farm during deployment the solution should not use default setting 'StartStop' for upgrading solutions. Spedifying 'Recycle' only recycles affected application pools and will not stop them.

See SPCAF documentation

rule.name: Do not deploy files directly into system folder
rule.description:
Solutions should not write in folders of system files directly. If you need to deploy a file in a system folder, use a project specific subfolder.

See SPCAF documentation

rule.name: Do not deploy batch files (.bat)
rule.description:
Batch files should not be included in the WSP package.

See SPCAF documentation

rule.name: Do not deploy PowerShell scripts (.ps1)
rule.description:
PowerShell scripts should not be included in the WSP package.

See SPCAF documentation

rule.name: Do not deploy setups (.msi)
rule.description:
Setups like .msi files should not be included in the WSP package.

See SPCAF documentation

rule.name: Do not deploy RootFile to TEMPLATE folder
rule.description:
Deploy a RootFile not to the TEMPLATE folder. Deploy this file as TemplateFile in the solution.

See SPCAF documentation

rule.name: Do not deploy RootFile multiple times
rule.description:
Deploy a RootFile only once to SharePoint. Do not deploy the file by different solutions because this could lead to problems if one solution is retracted and removes the file.

See SPCAF documentation

rule.name: Do not deploy Images to LAYOUTS folder
rule.description:
Do not deploy Images to LAYOUTS folder. Deploy to IMAGES folder instead.

See SPCAF documentation

rule.name: Deploy only Images to IMAGES folder
rule.description:
Deploy only Images to IMAGES folder. For files which are not images choose a different folder (e.g. LAYOUTS).

See SPCAF documentation

rule.name: Deploy binary files (like Assemblies) to ClientBin folder
rule.description:
Binary files should be deployed to LAYOUTS/ClientBin folder. This helps to find these files at the correct location.

See SPCAF documentation

rule.name: Do not deploy TemplateFile multiple times
rule.description:
Deploy a TemplateFile only once to SharePoint. Do not deploy the file by different solutions because this could lead to problems if one solution is retracted and removes the file.

See SPCAF documentation

rule.name: Do not deploy files of a Feature as TemplateFile
rule.description:
File which are deployed into the folder of a Feature should not be deployed as TemplateFile. Either deploy the files as ElementFiles in the Feature (preferred) or as Resources in manifest.xml.

See SPCAF documentation

rule.name: Do not deploy Features ElementFiles as Resources
rule.description:
Resource files can be used to deploy resources to an existing Feature folder. If the target Feature is part of the same solution package binary files should be deployed as ElementFile in the Feature. If the target Feature is not part of the package it does make sense to use Resources (e.g. to deploy additional languages to existing features).

See SPCAF documentation

rule.name: Deploy missing image for Feature
rule.description:
If a custom icon for a Feature is defined in attribute 'ImageUrl' the file should be deployed to SharePoint if not a SharePoint default image is used.

See SPCAF documentation

rule.name: Deploy missing ElementManifest or ElementFile in Feature
rule.description:
If ElementManifests or ElementFile are listed in the feature.xml these files must be deployed within the solution package.

See SPCAF documentation

rule.name: Do not deploy feature with same folder name multiple times
rule.description:
In some case the same feature is included in different WSP packages.

See SPCAF documentation

rule.name: Do not deploy feature with same ID name multiple times
rule.description:
In some case the same feature is included in different WSP packages.

See SPCAF documentation

rule.name: Do not deploy empty ElementManifests in Features
rule.description:
ElementManifests files in Features which do not contain any element have no purpose and should be removed from the solution.

See SPCAF documentation

rule.name: Do not deploy SharePoint assemblies as ElementFile
rule.description:
In some case Visual Studio or WSPBuilder include SharePoint assemblies into the package (e.g. Microsoft.Search.dll). This is not allowed.

See SPCAF documentation

rule.name: Do not deploy Webservice (.asmx) to LAYOUTS folder
rule.description:
A Webservice (.asmx) should not be deployed to '\TEMPLATE\LAYOUTS\' folder (url: '../_layouts/..'). It should be deployed to '\ISAPI\' instead (url '../vti_bin/..').

See SPCAF documentation

rule.name: Do not deploy Administration Webservice (.asmx) to ADMIN folder
rule.description:
A Administration Webservice (.asmx) should not be deployed to '\TEMPLATE\ADMIN\' folder (url: '../_admin/..'). It should be deployed to '\ADMISAPI\' instead (url '../vti_adm/..').

See SPCAF documentation

rule.name: Do not deploy a WCF Webservice (.svc) to LAYOUTS folder
rule.description:
A WCF Webservice (.svc) should not be deployed to '\TEMPLATE\LAYOUTS\' folder (url: '../_layouts/..'). It should be deployed to '\ISAPI\' instead (url '../vti_bin/..').

See SPCAF documentation

rule.name: Do not deploy a WCF Administration Webservice (.svc) to ADMIN folder
rule.description:
A WCF Administration Webservice (.svc) should not be deployed to '\TEMPLATE\ADMIN\' folder (url: '../_admin/..'). It should be deployed to '\ADMISAPI\' instead (url '../vti_adm/..').

See SPCAF documentation

rule.name: Deploy missing image for WebTemplate
rule.description:
If a custom icon for a WebTemplate is defined in attribute 'ImageUrl' the file should be deployed to SharePoint if not a SharePoint default image is used.

See SPCAF documentation

rule.name: Use resources for localizable attributes
rule.description:
All localizable attributes of SharePoint artifacts like ContentType, Feature etc. should use resources.

See SPCAF documentation

rule.name: Move resource key of ElementManifest to Feature resources
rule.description:
Localized attributes in ElementManifests (like ContentType) should use resources in the parent Feature, not in a RootFile (like '15\Resources\ResourceFile.resx').

See SPCAF documentation

rule.name: Localize property 'Title' and 'Description' in WebPart
rule.description:
Properties 'Title' and 'Description' in WebParts should be localized with .resx file.

See SPCAF documentation

rule.name: Define Solution name as valid namespace
rule.description:
To make it easier to identify the correct wsp solution in the solution store the name of the solution should be a valid namespace (e.g. 'Company.Project.Components.wsp').

See SPCAF documentation

rule.name: Files or Folders should contain the name of the parent solution
rule.description:
Files or their folders should be named after the solution. This helps do make the file location unique to prevent overwriting of existing files and it is easier to see which WSP solution deployed the file. The rule is case sensitive.

See SPCAF documentation

rule.name: Solution name should start with company name
rule.description:
The solution name should start with company name to follow the rule 'CompanyName.ApplicationName.ComponentName.wsp'.

See SPCAF documentation

rule.name: WebTemplate file in site definitions should start with 'WEBTEMP'
rule.description:
The name of the WebTemplate files should start with 'WEBTEMP'.

See SPCAF documentation

rule.name: Feature name should start with solution name
rule.description:
A feature name should be prefixed with the name of the parent solution. This helps to make the feature name unique and it is easier to see which WSP solution deployed the feature. The rule is case sensitive.

See SPCAF documentation

rule.name: Declare FieldType in File 'fldtypes_[namespace].xml'
rule.description:
The XML file which contains FieldTypes should follow the pattern 'fldtypes_[Namespace].xml'. [Namespace] represents the name of the WSP solution with replaced '.' with underscore. Reason: All FieldTypes are deployed to folder /SharePointRoot/Templates/XML and therefore must be stored in a file with a unique filename to avoid overriding existing FieldTypes from SharePoint or other custom solutions.

See SPCAF documentation

rule.name: Do not deploy ControlTemplates
rule.description:
Depending on the customization policy Solutions should not deploy controltemplates.

See SPCAF documentation

rule.name: Do not deploy Feature with scope 'Farm'
rule.description:
Depending on the customization policy Solutions should not contain farm features.

See SPCAF documentation

rule.name: Do not deploy Feature with scope 'WebApplication'
rule.description:
Depending on the customization policy Solutions should not contain webapplication features.

See SPCAF documentation

rule.name: Do not implement FieldType
rule.description:
Depending on the customization policy do not implement a custom FieldType.

See SPCAF documentation

rule.name: Do not implement Field
rule.description:
Depending on the customization policy do not implement a Field.

See SPCAF documentation

rule.name: Do not implement ContentType
rule.description:
Depending on the customization policy do not implement a ContentType.

See SPCAF documentation

rule.name: Do not implement ListDefinition
rule.description:
Depending on the customization policy do not implement a ListDefinition.

See SPCAF documentation

rule.name: Do not implement CustomAction
rule.description:
Depending on the customization policy do not implement a CustomAction.

See SPCAF documentation

rule.name: Do not implement CustomActionGroup
rule.description:
Depending on the customization policy do not implement a CustomActionGroup.

See SPCAF documentation

rule.name: Do not implement Event Receiver
rule.description:
Depending on the customization policy do not implement an Event Receiver.

See SPCAF documentation

rule.name: Do not implement DelegateControl
rule.description:
Depending on the customization policy do not implement a DelegateControl.

See SPCAF documentation

rule.name: Do not implement Coded Worfklow
rule.description:
Depending on the customization policy do not implement a Coded Worfklow.

See SPCAF documentation

rule.name: Do not implement DocumentConverter
rule.description:
Depending on the customization policy do not implement a DocumentConveter.

See SPCAF documentation

rule.name: Do not implement FeatureTemplateAssocation
rule.description:
Depending on the customization policy do not implement a FeatureTemplateAssocation.

See SPCAF documentation

rule.name: Do not deploy RootFiles
rule.description:
RootFiles cannot be deployed in a sandboxed solution.

See SPCAF documentation

rule.name: Do not deploy TemplateFiles
rule.description:
TemplateFiles cannot be deployed in a sandboxed solution.

See SPCAF documentation

rule.name: Do not deploy Resources
rule.description:
Resources cannot be deployed in a sandboxed solution.

See SPCAF documentation

rule.name: Do not deploy Farm Features
rule.description:
Features with scope 'Farm' cannot be deployed in a sandboxed solution.

See SPCAF documentation

rule.name: Do not deploy WebApplication Features
rule.description:
Features with scope 'WebApplication' cannot be deployed in a sandboxed solution.

See SPCAF documentation

rule.name: Do not deploy CustomActionGroup
rule.description:
CustomActionGroup cannot be deployed in a sandboxed solution.

See SPCAF documentation

rule.name: Do not deploy HideCustomAction
rule.description:
You cannot deploy a HideCustomAction element in a sandboxed solution.

See SPCAF documentation

rule.name: Do not deploy Delegate Control
rule.description:
You cannot register a control candidate for a delegate control (Control element) in a sandboxed solution.

See SPCAF documentation

rule.name: Do not define CAS Policies
rule.description:
The assemblies in a farm solution in SharePoint 2010 could be deployed with Custom Access Security (CAS) policies. Such policies are ignored in SharePoint 2013; all assemblies in farm solutions in SharePoint 2013 run with full trust.

See SPCAF documentation

rule.name: Declare attribute SharePointProductVersion='15.0' in Solution
rule.description:
The attribute 'SharePointProductVersion' with value '15.0' must be declared if files in 15 hive should be loaded. If not declared SharePoint assumes version '14.0'.

See SPCAF documentation

rule.name: Reference 15 hive in attribute 'Image' in ListTemplate
rule.description:
A ListTemplate can reference an image (like an icon) in attribute 'Image'. Ensure that the URL points to the 15 hive.

See SPCAF documentation

rule.name: Reference 15 hive in all images in CustomAction
rule.description:
A CustomAction can reference several images (like icons). Ensure that the URLs for these images points to the 15 hive.

See SPCAF documentation

rule.name: Reference 15 hive in attribute 'UrlAction' in CustomAction
rule.description:
A CustomAction can reference a page in attribute 'UrlAction'. Ensure that the URL points to the 15 hive.

See SPCAF documentation

rule.name: Reference 15 hive in attribute 'ScriptSrc' in CustomAction
rule.description:
A CustomAction can reference a script (e.g. .js) in attribute 'ScriptSrc'. Ensure that the URL points to the 15 hive.

See SPCAF documentation

rule.name: Reference 15 hive in attribute 'ControlSrc' in DelegateControl
rule.description:
A DelegateControl can reference a control template in attribute 'ControlSrc'. Ensure that the URL points to the 15 hive.

See SPCAF documentation

rule.name: Do not define TemplateAssociation to template 'Document Workspace'
rule.description:
The site template for 'Document Workspace' (STS#2) is not available in SP 2013.

See SPCAF documentation

rule.name: Do not define TemplateAssociation to templates for 'Meeting Workspace'
rule.description:
The site templates for 'Meeting Workspace' (MPS#*) is not available in SP 2013. This includes the Basic Meeting Workspace, Blank Meeting Workspace, Decision Meeting Workspace, Social Meeting Workspace, and Multipage Meeting Workspace.

See SPCAF documentation

rule.name: Do not define TemplateAssociation to template 'Personalization Site'
rule.description:
The site template for 'Personalization Site' (SPSMSITE#0) is not available in SP 2013.

See SPCAF documentation

rule.name: Do not define TemplateAssociation to templates for 'Group Work'
rule.description:
The site templates for 'Group Work' (SGS) is not available in SP 2013.

See SPCAF documentation

rule.name: Reference 15 hive within all XSLT files (.xslt)
rule.description:
Paths in XSLT files to '/_controltemplates/', '/_layouts/' and '/_layouts/images/' should point to 15 hive.

See SPCAF documentation

rule.name: Do not define element 'SupportedLanguages'
rule.description:
Do not define the element 'SupportedLanguages'. It has been deprecated in favor of the 'SupportedLocales' element.

See SPCAF documentation

rule.name: Remove WSP from Provider-hosted App
rule.description:
If an App is deployed as Provider-hosted the App should not contain a WSP. WSPs are only needed for SharePoint-hosted Apps.

See SPCAF documentation

rule.name: Do not define more than 25 'SupportedLocales'
rule.description:
A maximum of 25 locales is supported in element 'SupportedLocales'.

See SPCAF documentation

rule.name: Define App as Provider-hosted if AppWeb remains empty
rule.description:
If no Features are deployed to the AppWeb change the type of the App to Provider-hosted instead of SharePoint-hosted.

See SPCAF documentation

rule.name: Consider to reference external files without the scheme in web pages
rule.description:
The url to external files (.js, .css or images) should be used without the scheme (http, https). This prevents conflicts if the page is called either with http or https.

See SPCAF documentation

rule.name: Deploy missing ElementManifest or ElementFile in Feature (AppWeb)
rule.description:
If ElementManifests or ElementFile are listed in the feature.xml these files must be deployed within the solution package.

See SPCAF documentation

rule.name: Do not deploy empty ElementManifests in Features (AppWeb)
rule.description:
ElementManifests files in Features which do not contain any element have no purpose and should be removed from the solution.

See SPCAF documentation

rule.name: Deploy missing ElementManifest or ElementFile in Feature (HostWeb)
rule.description:
If ElementManifests or ElementFile are listed in the feature.xml these files must be deployed within the solution package.

See SPCAF documentation

rule.name: Do not deploy empty ElementManifests in Features (HostWeb)
rule.description:
ElementManifests files in Features which do not contain any element have no purpose and should be removed from the solution.

See SPCAF documentation

rule.name: Deploy all necessary .resx files for the supported locales
rule.description:
For each supported locale in element 'SupportedLocales' a corresponding .resx file must be exist in the App.

See SPCAF documentation

rule.name: Deployed .resx files should have a corresponding entry 'SupportLocale'
rule.description:
For each .resx file in an App a corresponding entry 'SupportLocale' in AppManifest should exist (except for 'Resources.resx'). Otherwise the .resx file should be removed from the App package.

See SPCAF documentation

rule.name: Deploy a invariant language resource file ('Resources.resx')
rule.description:
A invariant language resource file, (without a specific locale) should be contained in the App package with default values for all localized attributes.

See SPCAF documentation

rule.name: Localize the title of an App
rule.description:
Localize the attribute 'Title' of SharePoint apps to fully support localization. The title is what users see on the 'Your Apps' page.

See SPCAF documentation

rule.name: Do not use DebugInfo element in app mainfest
rule.description:
The manifest for your app for SharePoint must not include the DebugInfo element.

See SPCAF documentation

rule.name: Do not request full-control permission
rule.description:
An app for SharePoint cannot request full-control permission. Apps for SharePoint that request full-control permissions are not accepted in the Office Store.

See SPCAF documentation

rule.name: Define element 'SupportedLocales' in Apps
rule.description:
Localization support information is required in apps for SharePoint store through element 'SupportedLocales'.

See SPCAF documentation

rule.name: Define the solution name property
rule.description:
The package-solution.json file needs to contain the Solution Name property.

See SPCAF documentation

rule.name: Define a version number for your solution
rule.description:
The package-solution.json file doesn't contain the Solution Version property.

See SPCAF documentation

rule.name: Ensure that the solution version number is valid
rule.description:
The package-solution.json file doesn't specify a valid solution version number

See SPCAF documentation

rule.name: Define a valid id for your solution
rule.description:
The package-solution.json file doesn't contain the Solution Id property.

See SPCAF documentation

rule.name: Ensure that the solution id is valid
rule.description:
The package-solution.json file doesn't specify a properly formatted Solution Id (Guid).

See SPCAF documentation

rule.name: Specify solution configuration in the package-solution.json file
rule.description:
The package-solution.json file must specify solution configuration

See SPCAF documentation

rule.name: Specify solution paths configuration in the package-solution.json file
rule.description:
The package-solution.json file must specify solution paths configuration

See SPCAF documentation

rule.name: Specify the path of the zipped package in the package-solution.json file
rule.description:
The package-solution.json file must specify the path of the zipped package

See SPCAF documentation

rule.name: Define CDN base path
rule.description:
The write-manifests.json file doesn't specify the CDN base path.

See SPCAF documentation

rule.name: Specify valid CDN base path
rule.description:
The write-manifests.json file doesn't specify a valid CDN base path.

See SPCAF documentation

rule.name: React event handlers are defined using camelCased properties
rule.description:
React event handlers are defined using camelCased properties

See SPCAF documentation

rule.name: Specify the Web Part Id
rule.description:
The Web Part manifest must specify the id

See SPCAF documentation

rule.name: Don't use the same id for multiple web parts
rule.description:
Different Web Parts in the same project shouldn't be using the same IDs

See SPCAF documentation

rule.name: Specify the Web Part Title
rule.description:
The Web Part manifest must specify the Web Part Title

See SPCAF documentation

rule.name: Specify Web Part version
rule.description:
Web Part manifest must specify the Web Part version

See SPCAF documentation

rule.name: Specify valid Web Part version
rule.description:
Web Part manifest must specify valid Web Part version using a valid SemVer version number or *

See SPCAF documentation

rule.name: Specify the Web Part manifest version
rule.description:
Web Part manifest must specify the manifest version number

See SPCAF documentation

rule.name: Specify valid Web Part manifest version
rule.description:
Web Part manifest must specify a valid manifest version number

See SPCAF documentation

rule.name: Specify Web Part Properties
rule.description:
Web Part manifest must specify Web Part Properties

See SPCAF documentation

rule.name: Specify valid Web Part Id
rule.description:
Specify a valid Web Part Id using a Guid

See SPCAF documentation

rule.name: Use a valid font icon as Web Part icon
rule.description:
Web Part uses as icon one of the valid font icons

See SPCAF documentation

rule.name: Ensure that Web Part properties specified in the manifest are used in code
rule.description:
Web Part properties specified in the manifest should be used in code

See SPCAF documentation

rule.name: Specify the Web Part Description
rule.description:
The Web Part manifest must specify the Web Part Description

See SPCAF documentation

rule.name: Specify Web Part image
rule.description:
The Web Part manifest must specify a Web Part image

See SPCAF documentation

rule.name: Don't specify both Web Part icon and Web Part image
rule.description:
Web Part manifest shouldn't specify both the Web Part icon and Web Part image

See SPCAF documentation

rule.name: Specify valid Web Part image URL
rule.description:
Specify valid Web Part image URL

See SPCAF documentation

rule.name: Entry bundle must contain default export class
rule.description:
Entry bundle must contain default export class

See SPCAF documentation

rule.name: Don't load Web Parts from unapproved locations
rule.description:
Web Part is loaded from a location that hasn't been approved

See SPCAF documentation

rule.name: Don't reference scripts from unapproved locations
rule.description:
Web Part references script from a location that hasn't been approved

See SPCAF documentation

rule.name: React component files should have correct extension
rule.description:
Files defining React components should have either the .jsx or .tsx extension

See SPCAF documentation

rule.name: File that doesn't define React component shouldn't use the .jsx/.tsx extension
rule.description:
File that doesn't define React component shouldn't use the .jsx/.tsx extension

See SPCAF documentation

rule.name: Client Side Web Part doesn't use optimized scripts
rule.description:
Client Side Web Part doesn't use optimized scripts

See SPCAF documentation

rule.name: Use the latest versions of JavaScript libraries
rule.description:
Use the latest versions of JavaScript libraries which contain the latest bug fixes and security patches

See SPCAF documentation
